note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, this metric is [age-standardized](#dod:age_standardized). The data is restricted to those aged 30â€“79 years because hypertension prevalence is low before age 30 years and because guidelines differ in thresholds and treatment targets in older age groups.
title: Prevalence rate of hypertension in adults aged 30-79
subtitle: Estimated share of the population with [hypertension](#dod:hypertension), based on population representative surveys and statistical modeling. Hypertension is a [risk factor](#dod:risk-factor) for chronic complications, including [cardiovascular disease](#dod:cvd), and premature death.

display.name: Prevalence of hypertension in adults aged 30-79
